title: NHS England chief Amanda Pritchard says strike disruption will get worse
description: Amanda Pritchard told the BBC that patients were "paying the price" of failure to prevent strikes

author: Ellen Barry
title: Teenage Girls Were Behind a Surge in Mental Health Hospitalizations
description: During the pandemic, the proportion of teen girls visiting emergency rooms in mental health crisis rose 22 percent.

author: Chang Che
title: Logan Paul’s Energy Drink Under Scrutiny Over High Caffeine Content
description: Senator Chuck Schumer, the majority leader, has asked the F.D.A. to investigate a popular beverage created by the YouTube influencers Logan Paul and KSI over its high caffeine content.

author: Christina Caron
title: Tips for Practicing Gratitude, From Writing in Journals to Working Out
description: Nearly 800 readers shared some of their favorite tips.

title: Do Hormone Treatments for Menopause Increase Dementia Risk?
description: A new study suggests a link, but experts caution that there’s more to the story.

author: Paula Span
title: Substance Abuse Is Climbing Among Seniors
description: Many aging baby boomers have long histories with drugs, cannabis and alcohol. “The field wasn’t ready for that,” said one expert.

title: Junior doctors begin longest strike yet in England
description: Patients can expect disruption, with the five-day walkout over pay running until 07:00 on Tuesday.

author: Dana G. Smith
title: Older People Are More Vulnerable to Heat. Here’s How to Stay Safe.
description: If you’re over 65, it’s important to take high temperatures seriously.

title: How to Spot False Claims in Your Wellness Products
description: Dubious claims in product marketing are everywhere. Don’t fall for them.

title: How to Avoid Hunching at Your Desk
description: It’s time to get up (and fidget).

title: What You Should Know About the Potential Risks of Kratom
description: The herbal product remains widely available, despite lawsuits and warnings from health authorities.

title: NHS to expand use of private sector to tackle waits
description: Ministers in England want to unlock spare capacity, but Labour accuse them of dither and delay.

title: Stressed About Your Step Count? Even 4,000 Can Have Big Health Benefits.
description: But the more you walk, the better off you’ll be.

title: A Closer Look at Castor Oil
description: Social media proponents claim it can improve vision, reduce wrinkles, boost hair growth and more. But can it really do all that?

description: Julie and Neil Stout's daughter Jessica Mai died after giving birth in Ipswich Hospital in May 2021.

author: Dani Blum
title: How Bad Is Getting Covid Multiple Times? What to Know About Reinfection
description: Reinfections are becoming more common. Experts are still unsure about how damaging they can be.

author: Rozalynn S. Frazier and Courtney Yates
title: Meet the Women of the 40+ Double Dutch Club, Who Jump Rope for Joy
description: Meet the members of the 40+ Double Dutch Club, a group of women over 40 embracing the spirit of play.

title: Nurse Lucy Letby to be sentenced for murdering seven babies
description: Letby has indicated she will not attend court for sentencing. She also refused to appear when some of the verdicts were read out.

title: What is Screen Apnea? Why You May Breathe Less While Online
description: Here’s how to get “screen apnea” in check.

author: Andrew Leonard
title: How to Make Running Errands Count as Exercise
description: One reluctant exerciser found that ditching his car and walking or biking to the store was a boon for his mental and physical health.

title: Is Retinol Good for Your Skin? How It Can Help With Acne and Aging
description: To counter the signs of aging or treat acne, start slow and be patient.

title: How to Deal With Regret
description: You might even find it leads to some new insights.

title: Turkey surgery warning as mother-of-four dies after gastric sleeve
description: Shannon Meenan Browse died from malnutrition after gastric sleeve surgery in Turkey 18 months ago.

title: Can Covid Damage Your Heart? A Look At Short- and Long-Term Health Risks
description: Three years into the pandemic, the short- and long-term risks are becoming more clear.
